TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataListItem extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl implements class System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer, class System.Web.UI.INamingContainer

Docs.summary: Represents an item in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A DataListItem object represents an item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control, such as a heading section, a footer section, or a data item.
The data items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control are stored in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItemCollection> that can be accessed by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.Items%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.
You can use a DataListItem to programmatically access the properties of an item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use a DataListItem to display the contents of each data item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
[!code-vb[DataListItemCreated#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_79_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[DataListItemCreated#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_79_1.aspx)]

Docs.returns: A that contains the style properties of the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is primarily used by control developers, when extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> control.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual object DataItem { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a data item associated with the object in the control.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> that represents a data item in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the DataItem property to specify or determine the properties of a data item associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.
> [!NOTE] > This property only applies to data items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.ItemType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object must be set to one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType> enumeration values.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the DataItem property to display the contents of the data items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
[!code-vb[DataListItemCreated#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_1262_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[DataListItemCreated#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_1262_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets the index of the object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.Items%2A> collection of the control.
Docs.value: The index of the object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.Items%2A> collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the ItemIndex property to determine the index number of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.Items%2A> collection.
> [!NOTE] > This property only applies to data items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.ItemType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object must be set to `ListItemType.Item`, `ListItemType.AlternatingItem`, `ListItemType.SelectedItem`, or `ListItemType.EditItem`.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the ItemIndex property to display the index number of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.Items%2A> collection of the control.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see[ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
[!code-vb[Classic DataListItem.ItemIndex Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_942_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic DataListItem.ItemIndex Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_942_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the item represented by the object in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the ItemType property to determine the type of the item represented by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object. The following table lists the various item types.
|Item Type|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |`Header`|The heading section of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.| |`Footer`|The footer section of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.| |`Item`|An item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.| |`AlternatingItem`|An alternating item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.| |`SelectedItem`|The selected item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.| |`EditItem`|The item selected for editing in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.| |`Separator`|A separator between the items of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.| |`Pager`|The page selection section of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.|
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the ItemType property to determine the item type of the item represented by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object. The order that items are created in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control is displayed along with the item type.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
[!code-vb[DataListItemCreated#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_810_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[DataListItemCreated#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_810_1.aspx)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is used primarily by control developers when extending the functionality of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> control.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the control should set the attribute of the rendered HTML element to "disabled" when the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.IsEnabled%2A> property is .
Docs.value: if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RenderingCompatibility%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property indicates an ASP.NET version lower than `4.0`; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property indicates how ASP.NET should render HTML for a control when the control is disabled. If this property is `true`, ASP.NET renders a `disabled` attribute when a control is disabled. If this property is `false`, ASP.NET renders a `class` attribute when a control is disabled. For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.SupportsDisabledAttribute%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer.DataItem%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Object> that represents the value to use when data-binding operations are performed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.DataItem%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to retrieve the data object for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object.
The IDataItemContainer.DataItem member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer> interface.

Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer.DataItemIndex%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Docs.value: An integer representing the index of the data item bound to a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.ItemIndex%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to retrieve the data-item index for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object.
The IDataItemContainer.DataItemIndex member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer> interface.

Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer.DisplayIndex%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Docs.value: An integer representing the position of the data item as displayed in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.ItemIndex%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to retrieve the data-item index for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object.
The IDataItemContainer.DisplayIndex member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer> interface.
